DOC.brief_summary: To assess immune memory follow primary vaccination DTPw-HBV/Hib vaccine ass immunogenicity reactogenicity booster dose give 15 - 18 month age .
DOC.brief_title: Immune Memory DTPw-HBV/Hib Vaccine Following Primary Vaccination , Immuno & Reacto Booster Dose Given Infants
DOC.detailed_description: - Subjects receive DTPw-HBV/Hib primary vaccination without HBV birth randomise ( 1:3 ratio ) receive either : Plain PRP 10 month age follow DTPw-HBV 15-18 month age DTPw-HBV/Hib 15-18 month age . - Subjects receive DTPw-HBV + Hib primary vaccination without HBV birth receive DTPw-HBV + Hib booster . - Subjects receive DTPw-HBV/Hib primary vaccination HBV birth receive DTPw-HBV/Hib vaccine booster .
DOC.criteria: Inclusion criterion : For subject receive Plain PRP follow DTPwHBV : Male female infant , 10 11 month age , previously complete threedose primary vaccination course DTPwHBV/Hib vaccine . For subject receive DTPwHBV/Hib DTPwHBV + Hib : Male female infant , 1518 month age , previously complete threedose primary vaccination course DTPwHBV/Hib vaccine . For subject : Subjects investigator believe parent/guardian comply requirement protocol . Free obvious health problem establish medical history clinical examination Exclusion criterion : Use investigational nonregistered product study vaccine ( ) within 30 day precede administration study vaccine , plan use study period . Chronic administration immunosuppressant immunemodifying drug within six month prior administration study vaccine . Planned administration/administration vaccine foreseen study protocol start 30 day end 30 day administration study vaccine exception oral polio vaccine .
